abstract: The American Advertising Federation and the Institute for Public Relations announced the winners of several awards.
snippet: The American Advertising Federation and the Institute for Public Relations announced the winners of several awards.
lead_paragraph: American Advertising Federation, Washington, named seven executives as the 2014 inductees into the Advertising Hall of Achievement, for ad professionals who are age 40 or under. The honorees, to be inducted on Nov. 18, are Lauren Connolly, executive vice president and executive creative director at BBDO New York, part of the BBDO North America division of BBDO Worldwide, which is owned by the Omnicom Group; Sarah Hofstetter, chief executive of 360i, part of Dentsu; Ross Martin, executive vice president of Scratch, part of the Viacom Media Networks unit of Viacom; Erika Nardini, chief marketing officer at AOL; Elias Plishner, executive vice president for worldwide digital marketing at Sony Pictures Entertainment, a division of Sony; Bozoma Saint John, global head of marketing at Beats Music, which was recently acquired by Apple; and Jennifer S. Warren, senior vice president and chief marketing officer at RadioShack. Mr. Plishner will also receive the Jack Avrett Volunteer Spirit Award, presented to an inductee for public service.

headline.main: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
